name: Abstraction Ladder Quality Rubric

criteria.name: Level Distinctness
criteria.description: Each level is clearly distinct from adjacent levels with no redundancy

scoring.3: Levels are mostly distinct with minor overlap
scoring.5: Each level adds unique, valuable perspective

criteria.name: Transition Clarity
criteria.description: Connections between levels are logical and traceable

scoring.2: Some connections are unclear or missing
scoring.4: All transitions are clear and logical
scoring.5: Transitions reveal deep insights about the topic

criteria.name: Abstraction Range
criteria.description: Spans from truly universal principles to concrete specifics

scoring.1: Limited range; all levels at similar abstraction
scoring.2: Some variation but doesn't reach extremes
scoring.3: Good range from abstract to concrete
scoring.4: Excellent range; top is universal, bottom is specific
scoring.5: Exceptional range with measurable concrete details and broadly applicable principles

criteria.name: Concreteness at Bottom
criteria.description: Most concrete level has specific, measurable, verifiable details

scoring.1: Bottom level still abstract or vague
scoring.2: Bottom level somewhat specific but lacks detail
scoring.4: Bottom level has specific, measurable details
scoring.5: Bottom level includes exact values, measurements, edge cases

criteria.name: Abstraction at Top
criteria.description: Most abstract level is universally applicable beyond this context

scoring.2: Top level is somewhat general but domain-limited
scoring.4: Top level is universal within domain
scoring.5: Top level transcends domain; applies to many fields

criteria.name: Edge Case Quality
criteria.description: Edge cases meaningfully test boundaries and reveal insights

scoring.1: No edge cases or trivial examples
scoring.2: Edge cases present but don't challenge principles
scoring.4: Edge cases reveal interesting tensions or limits
scoring.5: Edge cases expose deep insights and prompt refinement

criteria.name: Assumption Transparency
criteria.description: Assumptions, context, and limitations are stated explicitly

scoring.1: No acknowledgment of assumptions or limits
scoring.5: Assumptions stated with analysis of how changes would affect ladder

criteria.name: Coherence
criteria.description: All levels address the same aspect/thread of the topic

scoring.5: Perfect thematic unity; tells a clear story

criteria.name: Utility
criteria.description: Ladder serves its stated purpose and provides actionable value

scoring.2: Some value but doesn't clearly serve a purpose
scoring.5: Exceptional utility; enables decisions or insights not otherwise possible

criteria.name: Comprehensibility
criteria.description: Someone unfamiliar with the topic can follow the logic

usage_instructions: Rate each criterion independently on 1-5 scale. Calculate average. Identify lowest-scoring criteria for targeted improvement before delivering to user.
